titleStmt.title: The liturgical-discourse of the holy sacrifice of the masse by omission of controversial questions; abridged and accommodated to the pious use of devout Christians in hearing masse, by A.F. the authour of the same at the instance of some devout friends.
titleStmt.author: Angelus à Sancto Francisco, 1601-1678.

titleStmt.title: The liturgical-discourse of the holy sacrifice of the masse by omission of controversial questions; abridged and accommodated to the pious use of devout Christians in hearing masse, by A.F. the authour of the same at the instance of some devout friends.
titleStmt.author: Angelus à Sancto Francisco, 1601-1678.

notesStmt.note: Place of publication suggested by Wing.
With a caption title on G11r: The second part, containing a brief explication of the masse.
A.F. = Angelus à Sancto Francisco which is the religious pseudonym for Richard Mason.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
